content: Just now I've changed "migrées" to "migrees" in 5-1) many insert statements (test) as non-ASCII characters are not shown properly in the CodinGame console. The output is unaffected.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice parsing puzzle, suitable difficulty and relevant tests. The author did respond to the feedback and fixed everything.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: OK, implemented with regular expressions

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool puzzle

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

1) You specify the start of a comment (--), but please also specify the end of a comment. Is that the EOL?

2) Please gives all your variables English names.

3) Please specify that you want the EOL removed if the removal of a statement results in an empty line. If SQL doesn't allow empty lines (non SQL programmers won't know), please specify so in the goal.

4) In addition to 3), please add empty lines in some tests, to verify that they are not removed.

5) Are the BEGIN and END keywords always at the start of a line? (Again, non SQL programmers won't know.)
If so, please specify in the goal.
Else, please add tests where BEGIN and END are not at the start of a line.

I couldn't see EXAMPLES overflowing lines "'The description of my rule ', 2, 'LOW', 'Java technologie');" and "The body is defined by BEGIN and END keywords." Is there some issue with formatting or is it an issue from CodinGame platform? Please confirm if this can be seen by you as well? 

Also, just clearing INSERT statements, keeping any comment that follows even in the same line makes it quite text filtration kind of a problem which can have an easier text processing in modern high level languages like Python but might not be very friendly for languages like C/C++. 
I understand that this is an Easy Puzzle, but I am not convinced with the requirements. Perhaps it can have improvements to make it easy as well as more fun.
So what's the logic in keeping the spaces before comments in test 2 & 3 but not int test 5?

Goal section
* Please add explanation of all syntax relevant to the solving of the problem: comments begin with {{--}}, the syntax used to denote a function, etc.

Output section
* The output consists of less than n lines. Please fix the description.

Thanks.

I add more details. Sorry, I wanted to keep it as short as possible because SQL query/SQL syntax is obvious for me. But you are right maybe it is not the case for everybody. I hope it is clearest now.

Hi,
You are right it is not consistent, I will do some fix to correct that point. Then let you know...

Hi,
there is no issue with formatting. maybe you can copy/paste input sample into text editor and check how it is looks like...

Actually, this puzzle is something, I had to code in my daily work... Then I wanted to "kill two birds with one stone" by submitting it here...

I think you are right It could be simplier if I adjust a little bit the requirements but for me the difficulty is good like that. I mean, it is an easy puzzle not a clash of code that you could write in 15 mns.

1) Yes end of comment is EOL.

2) Sorry, in the input samples, there are SQL keywords and variables or text in french. But there is no point to write in english the text the langage for a string pattern doesn't change anything.

5) BEGIN and END keywords are always at the start of a line. I will write that in the goal. Actually, it could have some empty space before Begin or end keywords but in the test I use, I always write BEGIN and END keywords at the start of a line to make it simplier.
Thank you very much!
Thank you very much.
Thank you very much

There is no issue with formatting, but there is a limitation of how CG displays the statement. It is meaningless if you want to show the examples, but the players cannot read them. Hence, would you please manually break the long line into several lines so that they can be shown fully? Thanks.

Hi,
I reduce the lengh of some long lines. I hope it will be clearest.

Thank you, but the problem has not been solved yet. Or maybe there is some misunderstanding. Here is a screenshot for your reference. I have already expanded my window to the widest possible, yet the example can still not be fully shown.

https://imgur.com/a/4fAL0Zx
Now I see what you mean. Actually, I use a 22 inch screen and I don't see the lines cut like you said. It is now corrected I think.

It's ok on my screen now, thanks.

By the way, is the semicolon a keyword? Is it ok to change “the keyword semicolon” to “the semicolon”?
ok done !

Hi,
I remove all empty line as input and as output. So there is no more question about spaces or empty lines....

Clearer now, thank you.

Goal section
* Last sentence: Please change "must kept" to "must be kept".

* Please mention that INSERT as a keyword always appears at the beginning of a line, after indentation if any.

* Please mention that keywords are case-insensitive.

Output section
* Please change "clean up" to "cleaned up"

* Please define [[m]] as the number of lines that remain.

Thanks.

I did the changes mention here except for :
"* Please mention that INSERT as a keyword always appears at the beginning of a line, after indentation if any."

INSERT is a key word but it is not mandatory to appears at the beginning of a line or after indentation. It is the same for BEGIN and END keywords. Actually, most of the time, people write 1 insert per line for visibility, it is clearest but you can write all insert on the same line separated by semicolon it will work.

The specifications are specific to this puzzle. You cannot leave that out, otherwise how are the players supposed to know how to identify the relevant lines?

At best you can add a clarification that the specification may differ from actual usage. Alternatively, add additional test cases to cover the situations you mention. But either way, you still have to write a bit - for the latter case, you would mention that INSERT can appear anywhere in a line.

I add more explanation and examples of INSERT that must be kept and INSERT that must be removed.

I add also a test with many INSERT statements all on the same line.

I hope it will be fine like that.
Examples are good, but we still need descriptions like what I mentioned.

I add the description : 

- INSERT statement is a statement that starts with the INSERT keyword and ends with the keyword semicolon ;. It can be written anywhere in the SQL file, it can be written on one or many lines. There is no constraint on where INSERT keyword appears first. It can start a new line or after spaces or it may have some indentation before the INSERT keyword

Tell me if it is still not enough.
